news.title: Garda arrested over alleged role in O’Connell Street incident after which man died
news.summary: A garda who was suspended last week has since been arrested for his alleged role in an early morning incident in which a man died on O’Connell Street in Dublin.

news.title: CAO points soar for popular courses amid record demand for college places
news.summary: CAO points have soared for many popular courses as the first round of college offers were issued today, with the cut in pandemic-era grade inflation bringing little to no comfort for the class of 2025.

news.title: RTÉ HR executive at centre of sweetheart deal scandal to leave Donnybrook station
news.summary: The RTÉ human resources chief who was central to a sweetheart deal scandal in Donnybrook is to leave the national broadcaster.

news.title: ‘Substantial tariffs’ – how Irish watchdogs could be target of Trump over EU's digital act
news.summary: Irish regulators that fine US tech firms could be targeted with visa restrictions, according to reports about US president Donald Trump’s latest trade threats.

news.title: ‘I will not be supporting Catherine Connolly’ – Labour’s Alan Kelly slams presidential candidate despite party’s endorsement
news.summary: Labour TD Alan Kelly has said he will not nominate Catherine Connolly as a presidential candidate and voted against the Labour party endorsing her campaign.

news.title: The five contenders to replace Pat Ryan as Cork manager
news.summary: The search for Pat Ryan’s successor continues after his departure over the weekend.

news.title: More than 1,000 patient samples reviewed amid concern over incorrect grading of precancerous cells at Drogheda hospital
news.summary: The results of samples taken from more than 1,000 patients are being re-examined in Our Lady of Lourdes Hospital in Drogheda after it was found medical reports by a former consultant showed the wrong grading for pre-cancerous cells in some cases.

news.title: Businessman Illann Power granted injunction against state agencies and ministers as he awaits trial
news.summary: Entrepreneur Illann Power, who is awaiting trial accused of almost 90 Revenue and reckless filing offences, was today granted an injunction in the High Court restraining five state agencies and three government ministers from disappearing any data that is material to his defence.

news.title: Three dead and 17 injured in shooting at school in Minneapolis
news.summary: A shooting Wednesday at a Minneapolis Catholic school killed two children as they prayed and injured 17 other people, 14 of them kids, the police chief and mayor said. The shooter also died.

news.title: John Walshe: CAO offers leave many students frustrated as high achievers lose out to those with inflated grades from previous years
news.summary: As students and parents across Ireland pore over this year’s college-entry requirements, many families face disappointment.
